Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RV-18 (Synthetic AMPs, RG-29 fragment, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid truncation, reptile cathelicidin fragment, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (62.07%) toRG-29K=R: 22%; G: 17%.Activity: active against A. baumannii ATCC19606 (MIC 4.69 ug/ml), E. coli ATCC8739 (MIC 4.69 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC 4.69 ug/ml), and S. aureus ATCC6538 (MIC 9.38 ug/ml). Warning: Non-standard assay.Structure:  random coil in aqueous solution and helical in 30 mM SDS.In vitro toxicity: showed minimal hemo.lytic till 100 ug/ml and little toxicity to HaCaT and HEK293 cells.
Literature Information.Author: Cai Y, Wang X, Zhang T, Yan A, Luo L, Li C, Tian G, Wu Z, Wang X, Shen D, Han Y, Zhang Z. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Rational Design of a Potent Antimicrobial Peptide Based on the Active Region of a Gecko Cathelicidin.
